text: Meresankh I was Ancient Egyptian queen of the 3rd dynasty of Egypt. She was a lesser ranked wife of Pharaoh Huni, mother of Pharaoh Sneferu, grandmother of Pharaoh Khufu. One of her great-granddaughters was named Meresankh II. Name of Meresankh appears on a fragment of the Palermo Stone. She is also mentioned at Meidum. Title of Meresankh was King's Wife. Queens' name means "She Loves Life". Here is a name of this queen written in hieroglyphs: U6-S29-S34 Category:Ancient Egyptian queens Category:3rd millennium BC in Egypt
title: Meresankh I
